tweets.text:
With heavy rain forecast, our officers have stepped up patrols, clearing screens and inspecting flood defences. 
Get the latest flood info & sign up to receive flood warnings here: 
https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb https://t.co/tWxRI5w92Y

It‚Äôs wet, wet, wet across the #Midlands today (Wednesday). Lots of surface water on roads. Please don‚Äôt drive through #flood water. 30cms is enough to float your car. Keep checking your #flood risk. Latest update here 
https://t.co/4HSc5MbL20 https://t.co/fMneKq3b7w
#StormChristoph currently 2 @EnvAgencyYNE flood warnings & 3 alerts in place for #Leeds. Keep updated and informed at https://t.co/FjsUnQcPZe #PrepareActSurvive

üåßÔ∏è With #FloodWarnings and #FloodAlerts in place for parts of #Lancashire, watch our video for steps to stay safe before, during, and after a flood and see: https://t.co/8Oh91nEOml

Follow @EnvAgencyNW & @TheFloodHub for updates
#LancsAlert #StormChristoph https://t.co/jZHobb4Ds8

urls.title: Flooding - Lancashire County Council
urls.description: If there is an immediate risk to your life or you are trapped by flood water call 999.

tweets.text:
#StormChristoph is continuing to bring heavy rain across England which can lead to #flooding. Check your flood risk and sign up for flood warnings: https://t.co/MPz7FwsWeY  

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/O3zNENsUPo

üì¢ Flood warnings are now being issued for parts of Lancashire, Greater Manchester, Merseyside and Cheshire meaning that flooding is expected. 

For the latest warnings visit ‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/uGQ4g6A5Xn 

#StormChristoph #Lancashire #GreaterManchester #Cheshire #Merseyside

With persistent heavy rainfall across the #Midlands today make sure you stay #floodaware 

‚ö†Ô∏èCheck your #flood risk: https://t.co/8HEpx2nkWv
‚ö†Ô∏èSign up for flood alerts:
https://t.co/4G9UCfW5wr 
‚ö†Ô∏è Call Floodline: 0345 988 1188

REMEMBER:‚ö†Ô∏è Never walk or drive through flood water! https://t.co/JoGOGP6DzU

Two #FloodWarnings have been issued for the #RiverRoch in #Rochdale & #Littleborough.

tweets.text: Four flood warnings are still in place for Lincolnshire - here's an update from @EnvAgency. https://t.co/8Vj0bouGjR
@EnvAgencyNW @MarcGra95162166 I hope you are right. ! Where will todays rain go then ? https://t.co/VSCJV2Rayw

Turn around, don't drown!

Remember just one egg cup of water is enough to wreck your engine, and just 15cm of moving water is enough to impact a small car.

Don't drive through floodwater.
@EnvAgency | @itvanglia | @itvweather https://t.co/Gt2T4L1Fj8

tweets.text:
Huge thank you to our operations staff, working round the clock putting up barriers, installing pumps, clearing debris etc. üôè

Behind the scenes we have 100s of staff across the country are monitoring rain & river levels. Taking action to help keep people safe. #FloodAware https://t.co/aDYZ3PhoYi

A rainy morning, but I went for a walk to the Sculcoates area, as I got to the River Hull the tide was very high, and the Wilmington Bridge started swinging to let a barge through, which was awesome to watch! https://t.co/5finuvmvbw

We have #floodalerts and #floodwarnings in place across the North West. 

Check your flood risk and sign up for flood warnings: https://t.co/uGQ4g6A5Xn

#StormChristoph #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/fiXvaBOMbi

‚òî Heavy rain will continue across #WestYorkshire today. If you live in a #flood area and are worried about your property #flooding, consider what actions to take now! 

üëâ https://t.co/y3DchuJIym

Keep an eye on @EnvAgencyYNE for updates.

#PrepareActSurvive #StormChristoph https://t.co/dcj7TE0r2C

@PaulReevesEA @EnvAgencyMids Yeah, its not under the sink...house is over 100 years old so goodness knows where they put it üòÖ the houses have never been flooded before so I'm going to sit in ignorant bliss for the day üòÖ

Both Sutton Bonington and Watnall have recorded 21.6mm over the last 48hrs. Capel Curig in Wales has been the wettest at 127mm. Amber Warning remains in place until 12:00 Thursday  #StormChristoph https://t.co/EMhdyHiWFZ

Latest water level of the River Mersey at Northenden this morning - take care and stay safe. Let's hope  #StormChristoph relents a bit to allow the levels to go down.üôè

Follow the local guidance, advice and warnings from @EnvAgencyNW and @ManCityCouncil 

https://t.co/4OMQ9XjKhB https://t.co/lH0xrhhtNi

With heavy rainfall expected in Bassetlaw over the coming days, please be #floodaware and sign up for alerts from @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/st7KJktSYJ
@amy_flanagandy @EnvAgencyMids There is usually a stop valve on the oil tank where the feed pipe connects. Mains water stop tap usually under the sink but varies particularly on older homes.

The @EnvAgency has issued flood warnings for River Roch at Littleborough and River Roch in Rochdale. Further details below. If you would like to report an incident in Rochdale affecting a property, please contact @RochdaleCouncil Floodline on 0300 303 0420 @gmpolice @EnvAgencyNW https://t.co/riNEJYA2LW

Our Flood Risk Manager @AndynBrown16 has been in #Croston where we have been operating one of our flood storage basins.

Make sure you sign up for flood warnings here: https://t.co/F1wbUHPZe8

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/ohmPMGkd1L

Ironbridge temporary flood barriers going up tomorrow. 

Due to heavy rain across Shropshire & upper Severn, barriers are needed to protect communities from #flooding. 

Wharfage resurfacing prep work had started, however this work is postponed while the barriers are needed. https://t.co/sY7ue1o4Lf

#StormChristoph continues to bring heavy rain across England. Stay safe at home - if you need to go outside, be alert to the hidden dangers of flood water and check your flood risk at: https://t.co/xNlgwQrrt9  

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/H7wc6P2CXd

If you have signed up for webinar 1 by the BSG Postgrad Forum, you should have received an email with everything you need to join us on Wednesday. If you haven't signed up but would like to, you can using this link https://t.co/1rqwYhtaV4. See you Wednesday!  #Geomorphology

tweets.text:
We've installed specially designed large steel beams into the river channel as a temporary barrier between the Ouse & Foss whilst the permanent gate is replaced.

These will provide #flood protection for nearby #York properties during the work even whilst river levels are high. https://t.co/SHPQBfgxNy

Floods | A new replacement gate is being air-lifted into place at the #FossBarrier this week, marking a major milestone in a ¬£38M upgrade that will reduce #flood risk to around 1,200 properties in #York

Full story: https://t.co/bzraAJK9Py

#Construction #Flooding #FloodDefences

tweets.text: @TimThom6 @RobStoneman @EnvAgency @YWDirectors @WildlifeTrusts Yes, but it made assumptions based on only two sites and ignoring different conditions elsewhere.
